title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 186-4.7 - Provision of a nurse for certain infants
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 186-4.7 - Provision of a nurse for certain infants

State Regulations
(a) When child performers between the age of
15 days and 6 weeks of age are employed, a nurse and a responsible person must
be provided for each three or fewer babies. When infants from age six weeks to
six months are employed, one nurse and one responsible person must be provided
for each 10 or fewer infants. Such nurse shall be a registered nurse with
significant experience in pediatric practice. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
186-4.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
